description: Marshall McLuhan's concept of the "global village" predicts that connecting the world through technology leads to simultaneous existence and new tribalism. This manifests in today's digital landscape with social media echo chambers and online communities. The article explores the power struggles over communication channels, the complexity of digital relationships, and the need for value pluralism in navigating our interconnected world.
